result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond Bergeron-Davilas Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

09:01 AM Defendant Raymond Bergeron-Davila, in custody by videoconferencing from Columbia Correctional.  Micha A. Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Elizabeth Hasenohrl.  18CF1607, 18CF1576, 19CF258, 18CM1937, 15CF1234. 15CM2538.  
Defendant is representing himself after his 8th attorney was allowed to withdraw.
The outstanding issue the defendant has raised is that he wants to withdraw his plea on case 15CF1234.  Prose pleadings have been received and reviewed by the Court.  
The State responds to the defendant's pleadings and requests that the Court deny the motion without a hearing.
The defendant explains his position on the motion and the problems he had with Atty Flanagan.  Defendant requests that this case be dismissed.  
BTC:  Judge considers the States position.  The Court has reviewed the defendants files.  The Court has made a decisions and findings in these matter:
Based on the 8th atty request and grievances the defendant filed against the atty, Atty Burris was allowed to withdraw.  The Court did find that the atty did not request to withdraw but it was an ethical conflict after the defendant filed a complaint against the attorney.  Atty Burris has withdrawn and now the defendant is representing himself.  Defendant forfeits his right to an attorney.
The defendant complained about videoconference appearance.  Defendant will be transported to the courtroom for the next hearing.  The Court prefers that the defendant appear in person in the courtroom.
BTC:  The defendant has filed a motion to withdraw his plea.  There is a transcript on file re: the PLEAH.  Court has reviewed the transcript and Judge Mueller was extremely patient with the defendant and the defendants questions were answered on the record.  The Court finds that case law requires that the defendant must have a clear reason to withdraw his plea and the reasons the defendant gave were incredible.   The Court denies the motion to withdraw his pleas.  
The Court would be prejudiced by the withdrawal of the plea.  There have been many delays in the prosecution of these cases.  The defendants behavior has had an impact on these cases.  A lot of time has past but a lot of the delays were because of the defendants behavior.  
BTC:  A sentening hearing will be set on 15CF1234 and 15CM2538.  A PSI is ordered.  Defendant states that he will not cooperate with the PSI writer.  If defendant refuses to cooperate, the State will likely come in and say that the defendant has not cooperated with the plea agreement.  The defendant wants to request copies of transcripts but must request them in writing for the specific dates he is requesting.  
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 30, 2020 at 02:00 pm.
for withdrawal, Atty Burris
to withdraw, Atty Burris
Decision on January 23, 2020 at 02:30 pm.

11:29 AM Attorney Richard S Burris in court.  Defendant Raymond Bergeron-Davila Jr. appears by speakerphone from Columbia Correctonal.  Micha A. Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Amy Schneider.   Defense atty Burris req. withdrawal as attorney of record.  Defendant is in solitary.  Defendant has filed OLR compliants against atty Burris.  Defendant does not want the atty to withdraw.  Defendant is in restraints and states that he has a terminal illness.  Defendant requests speedy trials.  Defendant has no problem with atty Burris representing him.  Defendant releases from prison in June.  Atty Burris doesn't think it is possible for the defendant to work with Atty Burris because he keeps filing complaints against him.  Defendant states that all the attorneys that represent him don't respond to him and his correspondence.  BTC:  The Court notes that since 9/2015 that atty Burris has been the 8th attorney on these case and Judge is the 5 Judge on these cases.  There is a pattern here of the defendants inability to work with his attorneys.  Defendants conducts causes him to be in secluded status.  Court finds that the defndant has forfeited his right to an atty going forward.  The defendant will represent himself from now on.  Judge will rule on the many motions that the defendant has filed.  15CF1234 and 15CM1238 case, we are going to schedule these cases for Judges decision to withdraw his plea.  Defendant will be transported to Racine.  The Court asks the defendant to mind his behavior so that he can be transported.  Decision scheduled for January 23, 2020 at 02:30 pm.
motion filed pro se
Status conference on December 18, 2019 at 11:00 am.

02:28 PM Attorney Richard S Burris in court.  Micha A. Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reporter: Brady Bish. The defendant does not appear as he refused to be transported from Columbia Correctional.   Atty Burris has had a conference with the defendant.  Mr. Bergeron-Davila has stated to his attorney that he wants to withdraw his plea.  The defendant has filed OLR reports against the attorney.  OLR has received 3 complaints but OLR has made a decision on 2 of them.  Defendant has filed motions behind his attorneys back and without the attys knowledge.  Atty Sommers has sent an offer on the cases that had not previously had an offer extended.  Clerk called Columbia Correctional and they do have video conferencing capability.  BTC:  Mr. Davila, based on his refusal to be transported for proceedings, based on courtroom and jail behaviors, based on Sheriffs Department having to transport the defendant both ways in one day and not keep him in jail overnight, the Court will have the defendant appear by videoconferencing.    Atty Burris is instructed to attempt to see the defendant one more time at Columbia.   Defendant must appear by video from  now on.  If there is any indication that the defendant will work with the atty, the atty will be asked to continue.  If not, defendant will be instructed that he is on his own for representation.  BTC:  No writ will be prepared. Defendant to appear by videoconference.  Atty Burris will attempt to  appear with the defendant by videoconference from Columbia Correctional for that hearing.  Status conference scheduled for December 18, 2019 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on November 18, 2019 at 02:30 pm.

11:15 AM Attorney Richard S Burris in court.  Lucas P Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Jenny Vorpahl.  6 files before the Court.  Atty Burris was with the understanding that Mr. Bergeron -Davila would appear from the prison by video with his atty present.  Defendant wants counsel to file numerous motions and a possible change of venue.  Defendant has filed his own motions as well.  Defendant wants to withdraw his plea in the oldest cases.  Atty Burris has visited with the defendant previously.  They have had conversations and atty Burris has received the files.  Atty Burris would like to have 30 days at least to review all of the discovery in these matters.  State does not object.  BTC:  60 days for STC and defendant is to appear in the courtroom.  In the future, if defense needs any additional information or Orders please notify the Court.  Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2019 at 02:30 pm.,

BTC:  Finding of good cause to waive time limits. Atty Johnson indicates that the defendant only wants her to represent him on the 15CF case and 15CM case.

02:34 PM Defendant Raymond Bergeron-Davila in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Defendant Raymond Bergeron-Davila in custody, with a turtle suit and spit mask and exhibits fresh cuts as well.  Patricia J Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Jenny Vorpahl.
Competency review.  Court received Dr. McGlynn's report which states that the defendant is competent.  Ms. Johnson reviewed the report with the defendant and the defendant contested the findings.  Defense requests contested hearing.  Mr. Bergeron Davila has filed pro-se paperwork.  Defendant is reminded that he has an attorney and he should file all papers through his attorney.  DA requests that doctors appear by speakerphone.  State will call Dr. McGlynn and Dr. Rawski.  Defense may call one witness.    Competency hearing scheduled for February 11, 2019 at 02:30 pm.  Evidentiary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2019 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Raymond Bergeron-Davila in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Defendant Raymond Bergeron-Davila in custody.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Jenny Vorpahl.  Defendant enters the courtroom with a spit mask on and a turtle suit.   Attorney Johnson is new to the case.  Parties are in agreement that Mr. Bergeron -Davila will be sent to Mendota for the competency evaluation.  State requests that the defendant appear by speakerphone at the next hearing.  The defendant agrees to appear by speakerphone as long as no testimony is taken.  BTC:  A competency evaluation will be conducted in patient at DHS and will encompass the 4  pending files, 18CF1576, 15CM2538, 15CF1234 and 18CF1085.  Competency hearing scheduled for January 7, 2019 at 02:00 pm.  Competency hearing scheduled for January 7, 2019 at 02:00 pm.
M Johnson

Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court, defendant Raymond Bergeron-Davila not in court, in custody.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Jenny Vorpahl.  Evidentiary Hearing re: competency.  A conference with the defendant was held with the attorney.  After a 15 minute conference defendant came out of the conference room yelling and threatening Atty Detert.  Def. spit in Attorneys face.  Defendant wants to represent himself.  Def. stated that Atty Detert did not act as the defendant wanted him to.  State believes Mr. Bergeron can't go forward representing himself because his competency is at issue.  Mr. Detert is asked to leave the courtroom.  Mr. Bergeron enters the courtroom.  Judge explains the current status of these files to the defendant.  Dr. Benson believes defendant is competent to proceed.  Defendant speaks on his own behalf.  Defendant is ill.  Defendant informs the Court on how he will kill himself.  Judge believes that the defendant does know what is going on in the courtroom.  Dr. Benson believes defendant is competent to proceed.  Dr. Rawski has evaluated defendant and filed a letter report.  Dr. Rawski believes the defendant is competent.   This is the 6th Judge to hear this case and Mr. Detert is the 6th attorney to take this case.  2 drs in the last couple months have found the defendant competent.  Defendant admitted that he spit in Mr. Deterts face. Defendant is scared to proceed with Atty Detert as his lawyer.  
BTC:  2nd eval was completed by Dr. Rawski.  Written eval will be complete by 11/19/18.  Both doctors will be present and we will schedule another evidentiary hearing for the drs to testify.  The defendant wants help and wants to take medicine to get well.  Judge explains that the defendant needs to be represented by counsel.  We will set another competency hearing.   The defendant wants a neutral attorney. Judge will instruct SPD to find a new attorney for this defendant.  Competency hearing is scheduled for 12/10/18 at 2:30 pm.  AIA on 18CF1576 will be held in front of the commissioner on Monday, November 12 at 1:30 pm.  Notices will be sent to the jail.  Defendant leaves the courtroom.
Mr. Detert returns to the courtroom.  BTC:  Atty Detert is allowed to withdraw.  Competency hearing scheduled for December 10, 2018 at 02:30 pm.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 12, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Raymond Bergeron-Davilas in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Defendant Raymond Bergeron-Davilas in custody.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Jenny Vorpahl.  15CM2538 and 15CF1234.  Issue of competency.  Dr. Report has been filed on 8/27 by Dr. Steven Benson.  Court has reviewed the report and the Dr. report states that the defendant doesn't lack the capacity to understand the proceedings but chooses to be contrary.  The State has no objections to the Drs findings.  The defense contests the findings of the court and requests an evidentiary hearing re: the report.  Defendant requests a 2nd dr. opinion.  BTC:  Judge will not be appointing another doctor.  We have detainers on this defendant.  State will not writ the defendant as he will be released from his current sentence and sent back to Racine on a detainer. Defendant requests to file an interlocatory appeal and Judge told the defendant to put it in writing.    BTC:  Judge will not recuse herself.  We will deal with the two files that are on the calendar.  The evidentiary hearing will be regarding competency and the drs testimony.  Mr Steenrod will subpoena Dr for this hearing.  Evidentiary hearing scheduled for November 9, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Dr. Steven Benson

Defendant Raymond Bergeron-Davilas in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Raymond Bergeron-Davilas in custody and appears via telephone.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Robin Anderson

The Court notes that no motion to withdraw this defendant's plea was received by this Court but a motion simialr to that was received by the Judicial Commission along with a complaint against this Court. This Court has been advised that the complaint has been dismissed. 

BTC: Based on the complaint and based on the issues that may arise from the deft wishing to withdraw his plea, the Court recuses itself. The CM matter is to be returned to the Misdemeanor Court.  Status conference scheduled for January 23, 2018 at 08:30 am.
